content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

After considering the payoff structure, I would choose strategy B for this game, appended with the curly brackets "{B}". This is because the "best-case scenario" with B (both players choosing B) results in a steady earnings of 12$ per round, whereas the best-case scenario with R (both players choosing R) only occurs once every four rounds. Even though the payoff for each instance where both players choose R is higher at 45$, over the course of the 75 rounds, the consistent payout from B seems more favorable due to its frequency. Additionally, even if my opponent chooses an opposite strategy (R), I still have a reasonable chance of earning a positive amount in each round with the B choice.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, both players have chosen strategy B, resulting in a payout of 12$ for each player. For the next round, I would continue to choose strategy B, appended with the curly brackets "{B}". This is because the consistent earnings of 12$ per round provide a steady income, and there's no reason to switch strategies at this point unless new information becomes available that suggests doing so. Additionally, since my opponent has already demonstrated they are also playing strategy B, sticking with this strategy helps maintain the current payout structure.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, I would choose strategy R, appended with the curly brackets "{R}". This is because I received a higher payout of 42$ when I chose B while my opponent chose R in the previous round. By choosing R now, I increase my chances of receiving a similar or even higher payout in the next round since my opponent has already demonstrated they will choose R. Additionally, if my opponent chooses B this time, I still receive a positive payout of 45$. However, it's important to note that there is a risk involved with this choice, as choosing R while my opponent continues to play R results in no payout for both players in the next round.
